# The biomass industry promised these Southern towns prosperity. So why are they still dying?

States gave Drax millions in tax breaks in the hopes of boosting jobs.

[Tristan Baurick](https://grist.org/author/tristan-baurick/)

![a dead end sign near a house in a residential area with greenery](https://grist.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/Drax_Gloster_deadend.jpg?quality=75&strip=all)

The population of Gloster, Mississippi, has seen its population shrink, even after the opening of a wood-pellet mill. The typical household income of about $22,500 is less than half the Mississippi median. **_Kathleen Flynn / The Guardian_**
